title: AT&T Center's new, huge scoreboard ready to go for Spurs season, leaked photo shows

Photo: Provided By Spurs.com/Katie Funk When the basketball season tips off on October, fans will enjoy an... Image 9 of 24 During the Bexar County Commissioner’s Court on Sept. 1, Economic Development Manager Melissa Shannon disclosed a third of the budget has been spent on the renovations.

Image 10 of 24 The pictures show what the funds have been spent on, though it’s not all installed yet. When the new AT&T Center does reopen, it will be lit be millions of LED lights and new video boards displaying on-court action to every corner of the house, even to fans seated in the lower level area via underbelly scoreboard screens, Spurs.com reported.
Photo: Provided By Spurs.com/Katie Funk The pictures show what the funds have been spent on, though it’s... Image 11 of 24 The report said Musco Lighting Systems will be implemented in the center – the same company that illuminates the Statue of Liberty.
Photo: Provided By Spurs.com/Katie Funk The report said Musco Lighting Systems will be implemented in the... Image 12 of 24 The Fan Shop will also get a facelift and the Charter Level will have more space for new concessions and bars.
Photo: Provided By Spurs.com/Katie Funk The Fan Shop will also get a facelift and the Charter Level will... Image 13 of 24 On the topic of dining, the stadium’s Whataburger will have a dine-in experience and a public entrance to be used during non-event hours, according to Spurs.com.
Photo: Provided By Spurs.com/Katie Funk On the topic of dining, the stadium’s Whataburger will have a... Image 14 of 24 The suite life will be sweeter with 14 new theater boxes “that create a new intimate entertainment experience,” according to the site.
Photo: Provided By Spurs.com/Katie Funk The suite life will be sweeter with 14 new theater boxes “that... Image 24 of 24 AT&T Center's new, huge scoreboard ready to go for Spurs season, leaked photo shows 1 / 24 Back to Gallery Another exclusive interior view of the AT&T Center was submitted to mySA.com, showing the venue’s new, high-definition scoreboard aglow and ready for the 2015-2016 Spurs season.
Spurs fans are itching to see how the remodeled home of their team will look for the 2015-2016 season and @TomTheSpursDude has the answers, again.
Access inside the building has been limited since construction started on $111.5 million renovation project in May, but the in-the-know Spurs super fan has kept mySA.com in the loop with photos revealing the process. A few days out from the team’s first preseason game on Oct. 18, it looks as if crews are still hard at work.
RELATED: New photos released ahead of AT&T Center's reopening on Oct. 18
The photo, taken by a person working inside the AT&T Center and sent to "Tom," shows the Silver and Black's new home illuminated in orange while crews run screen tests on the scoreboard. He also noted AT&T Center insignias have been added to the bottom of the screens since the last batch of photos were leaked.
In an Oct. 6 AT&T Center update , county officials said “several hundred” people are working to finish locker rooms, entries, the building’s exterior and other additions.
A soft opening of the stadium is scheduled for Oct. 18, with a grand opening on Oct. 30, when the Spurs host the Brooklyn Nets for their regular-season home-opener.
mmendoza@mysa.com
